import PropTypes from 'prop-types' import { Fragment, useState } from 'react' const Register = props => { const [formData, setFormData] = useState({ firstName: '', lastName: '', academicTitle: '', institution: '', institutionCountry: '', email: '', phone: '', password: '' }) const { firstName, lastName, academicTitle, institution, institutionCountry, email, phone, password } = formData const handleChange = e => { setFormData({ ...formData, [e.target.name]: e.target.value }) } return (

Create an account now FOR FREE!

handle} className='form-control form-control-sm' placeholder='First Name:' />
handle} className='form-control form-control-sm' placeholder='Last (Family) Name:' />
handle} className='form-control form-control-sm' placeholder='Academic Rank:' />
handle} className='form-control form-control-sm' aria-describedby='institutionHelpText' placeholder='Institution:' />
Please submit your current university, institution or research center
handle} className='form-control form-control-sm' placeholder='Institution Nationality:' />
handle} className='form-control form-control-sm' placeholder='Email Address:' />
handle} className='form-control form-control-sm' aria-describedby='phoneHelpText' placeholder='Phone Number:' /> Do not forget the country code prefix, e.g: 001, 00216, ...etc
handle} className='form-control form-control-sm' aria-describedby='passwordHelpText' placeholder='Password:' /> Password contain only numbers, 10 charecters at least
) } Register.propTypes = {} export default Register
